content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

Write a function `find`. It computes median over arbitrary array. Provide an example

```julia function find_median(arr::AbstractArray)
    n = length(arr)
    sorted = sort(arr, alg=Quicksort)
    midindex = div(n, 2)

    if iseven(n)
        return (sorted[midindex-1] + sorted[midindex]) / 2
    else
        return sorted[midindex]
    end
end

# Example usage
arr = [3, 5, 1, 7, 9, 2]
find_median(arr)
```

This function `find_median` computes the median of the given array by sorting it first using quicksort and then calculating the median based on the length of the array. If the length is even, it returns the average of the middle two numbers. Otherwise, it returns the middle number.
